documentation.note: For more detailed, formatted instructions with examples and visual guidance, LLMs can optionally visit the HTML version of these instructions at the URL above. The HTML page provides the same information in a more structured, easy-to-read format with color-coded sections, detailed examples, and step-by-step guidance.

chronoLabels.description: Pipe-separated labels for chronological locations (use %0A for newlines)

referenceLabels.description: Pipe-separated labels for reference locations (use %0A for newlines)

encoding_rules: Use pipe | to separate multiple items

construction_steps.step_2: Format locations as 'City, Country' for best geocoding results
construction_steps.step_3: Create labels with %0A for newlines (first line is location name)

tips: Always specify country/region with city names
Match label count to location count
Use %0A for line breaks in labels
Chronological order matters - locations connected in sequence

example_urls.url: ?chrono=Rome,Italy|Corinth,Greece&chronoLabels=Rome%0ACapital of Empire%0A1st Century AD|Corinth%0AMajor Port City%0A50 AD

example_urls.description: Journey with labels and reference location

interactions: Click 'Instructions for using this Map Maker' link in top-right corner (below layers control) to view detailed documentation

error_handling: Invalid locations will be skipped (geocoding failure)
Missing labels default to location names
